intro: Psychotria subimbricata, commonly known as the "Blue Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers, which are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria subimbricata is also noted for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
